questions.question_text: What is Angular primarily used for
options: Mobile app development with native code
questions.correct_answer: Building single-page web applications
questions.explanation: Angular is a popular framework for building dynamic single-page web applications

questions.question_text: Which command is used to create a new Angular project
questions.correct_answer: ng new my-app
questions.explanation: The ng new command initializes a new Angular workspace and application

questions.question_text: What is a component in Angular
options: A fundamental building block of an Angular application
A type definition for data models
questions.correct_answer: A fundamental building block of an Angular application
questions.explanation: Components are the main building blocks for UI in Angular applications

questions.question_text: How do you display a variable value in an Angular template
questions.correct_answer: {{ variableName }}
questions.explanation: Interpolation using double curly braces is used to display variable values in templates

questions.question_text: What is TypeScript in the context of Angular
options: A superset of JavaScript that adds static types
questions.correct_answer: A superset of JavaScript that adds static types
questions.explanation: Angular applications are built using TypeScript which provides type safety and other benefits

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of an Angular module NgModule
options: To declare components directives and pipes and organize application parts
questions.correct_answer: To declare components directives and pipes and organize application parts
questions.explanation: NgModules are used to organize an application into cohesive blocks of functionality

questions.question_text: Which decorator is used to define a component in Angular
questions.correct_answer: @Component
questions.explanation: The @Component decorator marks a class as an Angular component and provides configuration metadata

questions.question_text: What is data binding in Angular
options: Synchronizing data between the component and the DOM
questions.correct_answer: Synchronizing data between the component and the DOM
questions.explanation: Data binding is a mechanism that allows you to link data between the component and its template

questions.question_text: How do you pass data from a parent component to a child component in Angular
questions.correct_answer: Using @Input decorator
questions.explanation: The @Input decorator allows a child component to receive data from its parent component

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of Angular Router
options: To enable navigation between different views or components
questions.correct_answer: To enable navigation between different views or components
questions.explanation: The Angular Router allows you to define navigation paths and display different components based on the URL

questions.question_text: When should you use an Angular service
options: For logic that needs to be shared across multiple components or for data fetching
questions.correct_answer: For logic that needs to be shared across multiple components or for data fetching
questions.explanation: Services are used to encapsulate reusable logic and data access that can be injected into components and other services

questions.question_text: What is the difference between constructor and ngOnInit lifecycle hook in an Angular component
options: Constructor is for dependency injection ngOnInit is for initial data fetching
Constructor is for UI initialization ngOnInit is for event handling
Constructor runs after ngOnInit ngOnInit runs before
There is no significant difference they serve the same purpose
questions.correct_answer: Constructor is for dependency injection ngOnInit is for initial data fetching
questions.explanation: The constructor is primarily for dependency injection while ngOnInit is a lifecycle hook called after Angular initializes the component's data-bound properties

questions.question_text: How do you emit an event from a child component to its parent component
options: Using a global event bus service
questions.correct_answer: Using @Output and EventEmitter
questions.explanation: The @Output decorator combined with EventEmitter allows a child component to emit custom events that a parent can listen to

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of HttpClient in Angular
options: To make HTTP requests to backend services
questions.correct_answer: To make HTTP requests to backend services
questions.explanation: HttpClient is Angular's built-in module for making HTTP requests to interact with APIs

questions.question_text: Explain the concept of Ahead-of-Time AOT compilation in Angular and its main benefit
options: It compiles templates at runtime for faster development cycles
It compiles Angular HTML and TypeScript into efficient JavaScript during the build process resulting in faster startup and smaller bundles
It compiles CSS files into JavaScript for better performance
It compiles backend code to run on the client side
questions.correct_answer: It compiles Angular HTML and TypeScript into efficient JavaScript during the build process resulting in faster startup and smaller bundles
questions.explanation: AOT compilation pre-compiles application components and templates during the build phase leading to faster rendering and smaller application size

questions.question_text: What are the two main change detection strategies in Angular and when would you use OnPush
options: Default and Manual OnPush is for simple components
Default and OnPush OnPush is used for performance optimization when inputs are immutable or observable
Automatic and Explicit OnPush is for server-side rendering
Synchronous and Asynchronous OnPush is for complex data structures
questions.correct_answer: Default and OnPush OnPush is used for performance optimization when inputs are immutable or observable
questions.explanation: Angular has Default and OnPush change detection strategies OnPush is used to optimize performance by only checking for changes when input properties change or an event is emitted

questions.question_text: What is NgZone and why is it important in Angular applications
options: It is a module for internationalization
It is a service for managing HTTP requests
It is an execution context that allows Angular to detect when asynchronous operations complete and trigger change detection
It is a tool for debugging component trees
questions.correct_answer: It is an execution context that allows Angular to detect when asynchronous operations complete and trigger change detection
questions.explanation: NgZone wraps asynchronous operations and notifies Angular when they complete allowing Angular to run change detection efficiently

questions.question_text: Describe the concept of dependency injection DI in Angular and its benefits
options: A way to inject CSS styles into components for better theming
A design pattern where a class receives its dependencies from external sources rather than creating them itself promoting modularity and testability
A method for injecting data directly into the DOM bypassing components
A technique for injecting HTML templates into components dynamically
questions.correct_answer: A design pattern where a class receives its dependencies from external sources rather than creating them itself promoting modularity and testability
questions.explanation: DI in Angular allows components and services to declare their dependencies which are then provided by the Angular injector promoting loose coupling and easier testing

questions.question_text: How can you optimize the performance of an Angular application related to rendering large lists
options: By using ngIf instead of ngFor
By implementing trackBy function with ngFor and using OnPush change detection strategy
By loading all data at once regardless of list size
By avoiding component creation for list items
questions.correct_answer: By implementing trackBy function with ngFor and using OnPush change detection strategy
questions.explanation: Using trackBy with ngFor helps Angular identify which items have changed added or removed minimizing DOM manipulation OnPush further reduces unnecessary change detection cycles

questions.question_text: When would you use a custom structural directive in Angular
options: To change the style of an element based on a condition
To add event listeners to an element
To manipulate the DOM layout by adding or removing elements based on a condition
To create a reusable piece of UI with its own logic
questions.correct_answer: To manipulate the DOM layout by adding or removing elements based on a condition
questions.explanation: Structural directives like ngIf and ngFor manipulate the DOM by adding or removing elements A custom structural directive allows you to create similar conditional rendering logic
